publish: 2025 International Conference on NexGen Networks and Cybernetics (IC2NC)
abstract: Early and accurate plant disease identification is essential for improving crop productivity and minimizing economic losses in modern agriculture. This study proposes a deep learning-based framework for automatic plant disease detection and pesticide recommendation using a Convolutional Neural Network (CNN). The model is trained and evaluated on the publicly available PlantVillage dataset, which contains diverse leaf images affected by multiple crop diseases. The proposed CNN architecture effectively extracts hierarchical features and achieves superior classification performance compared to the traditional machine learning techniques. Extensive experiments demonstrate that the CNN model attains an accuracy of $98.8 \%$, outperforming Support Vector Machine (SVM) and Random Forest (RF) classifiers, which exhibit lower accuracy due to their limited feature extraction capabilities. Based on the predicted disease class, the system further recommends suitable chemical or biological pesticides aligned with standard agricultural guidelines, ensuring practical utility for farmers and agronomists. The results confirm that deep learning-driven disease identification combined with automated pesticide recommendation offers a reliable and efficient decision-support system for precision agriculture.

title: Underwater Image Enhancement Based on Diffusion Model
authors: Zhu Yi-Fei, Liu Jun, Fang Lin-Kun
publish: 2025 8th International Conference on Robotic Systems and Applications (ICRSA)
abstract: Underwater imaging environments are inherently complex, often resulting in images that suffer from blur, low contrast, and color distortion, thereby posing significant challenges for subsequent underwater vision tasks. In this work, we propose a diffusion model-based network for underwater image enhancement, which exploits the intrinsic reconstruction capabilities of diffusion processes to restore distorted inputs. To mitigate the high computational cost, prolonged inference time, and potential instability associated with conventional diffusion models, we introduce a conditional diffusion framework grounded in discrete wavelet transforms. This design enables us to maintain high restoration fidelity while substantially reducing computational overhead. Moreover, our training regime incorporates both forward diffusion and denoising steps to further constrain randomness and improve convergence. To specifically address the unique artifacts encountered in underwater scenes, we integrate a deep learning-driven channel attention module that adaptively refines feature representations, leading to enhanced image clarity, contrast, and color consistency. Extensive experiments on publicly available underwater enhancement benchmarks demonstrate that our approach outperforms both classical algorithms and contemporary deep learning methods across multiple quantitative metrics.

title: Secure Remote Access: A Scalable VPN Framework using Machine Learning-based Intrusion Detection with Random Forest
authors: David Neels Ponkumar Devadhas, S Arun Kumar, Syed Mahammed Afzal, Mahmad Muskhan, Sangaraju Joshika, R Julian Menezes
publish: 2025 International Conference on NexGen Networks and Cybernetics (IC2NC)
abstract: As the volume of data exchanged is growing and the number of remote workers is also rising, the need for reliable and secure remote access solutions becomes much more critical in the IT domain. This research work presents a model for secure remote access by integrating a scalable VPN infrastructure with a machine learning-based Intrusion Detection System employing the Random Forest algorithm. The framework has been built in such a way that it can identify and block the access attempts made illegally in real time and thus ensure remote users an uninterrupted and secure network. The basic structure is not only supportive of scaling that is ultimately utilized to handle the various loads but is also highly intelligent that it adapts to new and changing attack patterns by continuously learning. The distinctiveness of this innovation comes from the fact that the Random Forest algorithm is seamlessly fused with the VPN structure to achieve the required level of security. The proposed method relies on the use of the Random Forest algorithm to classify the network traffic and to detect abnormal behavior while keeping the VPN performance unchanged. The Random Forest algorithm is taught using labelled network traffic data, which means that it can accurately determine if an activity is harmful or is legitimate. The method’s ensemble feature is responsible for increasing precision in the detection of the attack and therefore for reducing false positives which gives the detection of the threat a rapid effect. Moreover, the framework has also been adapted for a smooth distribution and deployment in different environmental settings which makes it a very practical and useful solution for companies looking for a secure and intelligent remote access.

title: Adaptive Cognitive Digital Twin Framework for Efficient Smart City Operations
authors: V S Krushnasamy, Mansoor Farooq, Naama Hussein Al-Muraad, Omar Mohsen Hussein, Abdalsalam Taha Hussain Ali, K. Selvakumarasamy
publish: 2025 International Conference on NexGen Networks and Cybernetics (IC2NC)
abstract: The rapid evolution of cyber-physical smart cities necessitates intelligent, adaptive systems capable of handling vast urban complexities. Therefore, a Cognitive Digital Twin (CDT) framework built on real time sensor data, deep learning, anomaly detection and blockchain based security to enhance urban operation like traffic control, energy management and public safety has been presented in this research. The target is to construct a scalable self-learning AI model that assists the prediction analytics and thereby the decision making for the smart cities. In contrast to methodical digital twins, the proposed CDT combines both the advanced AI and distributed cloud-edge computing to both speed up data processing and to create more accurate forecasting. The contribution of this work is in its holistic approach by integrating time series forecasting, anomaly detection, and energy consumption prediction in a single AI Driven system and has been verified for both simulation environments as well as real world setup. RMSE and MAPE metrics are used to assess the system performance in terms of processing latency values of around 50 milliseconds for one thousand IoT devices and MAPE values below industry thresholds. Robustness, scalability and precision of urban data management is demonstrated with CDT through optimization of resource allocation, improvement of public safety responsiveness and sustainability of urban development. These results confirm the proposed model’s ability to improve the urban management efficiency to a great extent while ensuring the stringent data security and system resilience.

title: APRIX - Anomaly Powered Retail Index
authors: Punitha R, P. Sharmila, Nandhitha B, Harini M, Shreyaa V
publish: 2025 IEEE Pune Section International Conference (PuneCon)
abstract: The rapid rise of quick-commerce platforms such as Zepto, Blinkit, and Swiggy Instamart has led to the marginalization of small and independent local retailers, especially in urban and semi-urban areas. These platforms often inflate product prices and impose delivery charges, making essential goods more expensive for cost-conscious consumers. Simultaneously, small retailers struggle to compete due to their lack of digital visibility and limited technological infrastructure. This paper introduces APRIX (Anomaly Powered Retail Index), a mobile-based solution designed to digitally empower local retailers by connecting them directly with nearby shoppers within a 500-meter radius. APRIX enables real-time product availability, shop status updates, and transparent pricing. It integrates a tag-based recommendation engine to personalize the shopping experience and employs anomaly detection techniques to identify and flag pricing irregularities. The system features three distinct modules for Admin, Retailer, and Shopper roles, providing tailored functionalities across the ecosystem. By eliminating intermediaries and supporting hyperlocal commerce, APRIX enhances the shopping experience for users while promoting digital inclusion and economic sustainability for small retailers.

title: EvoTexFit: Perceptually Aware and Efficiently Adaptable Framework for Fashion Image Editing
authors: Yikai Li, Yin Chen
publish: 2025 6th International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Computer Engineering (ICAICE)
abstract: Text-driven fashion editing enables intuitive control over garment appearance through natural language, but current methods often suffer from coarse localization and limited texture realism. To address these limitations, we propose EvoTexFit, a perceptual enhancement framework for text-based clothing editing. EvoTexFit incorporates a Cross-Perceptual Channel Attention module into the mask-generation stage to strengthen multi-scale feature interaction and improve region perception, enabling more accurate clothing area localization. Additionally, we introduce LoRA-based lightweight adaptation to efficiently fine-tune large models with minimal computational cost while preserving identity and garment structure. Extensive experiments on the DFMM-Spotlight dataset demonstrate that EvoTexFit achieves improved texture fidelity, color realism, and editing accuracy compared to TexFit and diffusion-based baselines. Our method provides a more robust and computationally efficient paradigm for controllable fashion manipulation, paving the way for enhanced try-on and virtual design applications.

title: Establishing Ensemble Boosting Algorithm Based Models with SMOTE to Forecast the Initial Vulnerability of Gastric Cancer (GC) with Patient Dataset
authors: M.V. Karthikeyan, P Lourdu Mahimai DOSS, Annie Christina, G Brindha, M.V.Senthamizh Selvi, C.Venkatesh Kumar
publish: 2025 2nd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Knowledge Discovery in Concurrent Engineering (ICECONF)
abstract: Gastric cancer (GC) remains a significant global health concern, exhibiting persistently high mortality rates predominantly attributable to late-stage clinical diagnosis. Prognostic and therapeutic outcomes could be considerably optimized through timely identification at incipient stages. This study advances an ensemble-oriented machine learning (ML) paradigm integrating state-of-the-art boosting algorithm with the synthetic minority over-Sampling technique (SMOTE) to strengthen predictive modeling for early-stage Gastric cancer. A dataset encompassing comprehensive clinical Oti and demographic attributes form a repeatable source underwent rigorous preprocessing, SMOTE-based class rebalancing and subsequent evaluation across four ensemble boosting architectures: XG Boost, LightGMB, catBoost and AdaBoost. Comparative performance appraisal employed accuracy, precision, recall, and FI-score metrics to rigorously assess early-stage GC prediction efficacy. Empirical results demonstrated that cat Boost achieved superior accuracy (85.67%), closely followed by XG Boost (85.03%) and Light GBM (84.76%), whereas Atla Boost that boosting-based ensemble techniques substantially enhance predictive reliability while alleviating bias within clinical datasets. This evidence the potential of ML-enhanced early-diagnostic frameworks to augments clinical decision making and ultimately improve patient-survival statistically. Future research trajectories may involve deep learning integration and institute clinical validation to further advance predictive robustness.

title: Performance Evaluation and Comparative Analysis of Energy-Efficient Clustering of Data Routing Protocols for WSNs
authors: Zahid Ullah Khan, Hongyuan Gao, Zhaoran He, Jingya Ma, Muhammad Aman
publish: 2025 IEEE 4th International Conference on Computing, Communication, Perception and Quantum Technology (CCPQT)
abstract: Nowadays, the use of Wireless Sensor Networks (WSNs) is inevitable in many applications on a daily basis. However, these WSNs consume a lot of energy while routing the data from one sensor cluster to another. So, with the passage of time, researchers have equipped the WSNs with routing protocols. They have the capability to identify the most efficient route to transmit data packets from the anchor Tx node to the sensor Rx node. Yet one of the goals of these data routing protocols is to manage energy consumption between clusters, ensuring efficient energy distribution across all sensor nodes in the network, with priority given to areas where it's most needed. So in this study, we have done examinations of Low-Energy Adaptive Clustering Hierarchy (LEACH), LEACH-Centralized (LEACH-C), and Power-Efficient Gathering in Wireless Sensor Information Systems (PEGASIS) protocols. Where we evaluate their performance, focusing on energy efficiency. When the aforementioned data routing protocols are tested, the simulation results demonstrate better performance in increasing energy efficiency, which ultimately helps us to achieve better network lifetime.

title: OvaAI: HyperFused Multi-Modal Deep Learning and Graph-Augmented Diagnostics for Early Ovarian Cancer Detection
authors: N.N. Varsha, J.Jegan Amarnath, V. Kavitha
publish: 2025 IEEE Pune Section International Conference (PuneCon)
abstract: Ovarian cancer is considered as one of the most life-threatening gynecological cancers because it is asymptomatic at the early stages and due to the weaknesses of the standard screening practices. The current paper introduces OvaAI, HyperFused Multi-Modal Deep Learning and Graph-Augmented Diagnostic platform, which is targeted at detecting early cancer in ovaries, classifying cancer types, and predicting the stage. OvaAI combines imaging (ultrasound, CT, MRI) using hybrid CNN-DenseNet models, serum biomarkers (CA-125, HE4, LDH) using MLP with attention, and genomic profiles using Graph Neural Networks (GNNs) to overcome the moral, biochemical, and molecular information, respectively. A HyperFused Attention Layer is a dynamically weighted cross-modal feature, which boosts cross-modal correlations as well as interpretability. The framework applies a multi-stage classification approach, and it includes cancer detection, subtype classification, and stage forecasting. Assessed on TCIA, Kaggle, clinical biomarker datasets and TCGA-OV, OvaAI has over 96% accuracy, over 95% F1-score and ROC-AUC over 0.97, compared to single and dual-modality models. Grad-CAM and attention mapping explanatory analyses and feature importance score analyses offer clinically meaningful information. OvaAI: OvaAI presents a powerful, interpretable, and clinically implementable solution, which enables the detection of ovarian cancer in its early stages, the development of personalized treatment plans, and the risk stratification of subtypes, which close essential gaps in the diagnosis of ovarian cancer.

title: A Secure Cloud-Based EHR System Integrating Advanced Blockchain Technology with an Attribute-Based Cryptosystem
authors: M. Monica Bhavani, M. Uma Latha, V. Gomathi, Vijay Anand P, S.L. Swarna, S Saravana Kumar
publish: 2025 2nd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Knowledge Discovery in Concurrent Engineering (ICECONF)
abstract: Electronic health records (EHRs) contain very confidential patient information that must be safeguarded against unwanted access and manipulation. Conventional security solutions, like as role-based access control and data encryption, are inadequate to fulfil the security needs of EHR systems. Our proposition involves the implementation of an innovative and reliable Electronic Health Record (EHR) system that leverages attribute-based cryptosystem (ABE) and blockchain technology. ABE enables precise access control, ensuring that only authorized individuals possessing particular criteria may have access to encrypted data. Blockchain offers an immutable and easily verifiable record of all data exchanges. Our system also incorporates a novel cryptographic primitive known as combination attribute-based/identity-based encryption and signature (C-AB/IB-ES). The C-AB/IB-ES cryptosystem integrates the features of ABE, identity-based encryption (IBE), and identity-based signing (IBS) into a unified system. This streamlines the management of the system and obviates the need of implementing various cryptographic techniques. We provide a practical demonstration of our technology specifically designed for the medical insurance sector. The system we have developed enables the safe and transparent management of critical patient data among health insurance carriers, hospital service providers, and consumers.

title: Architecting Resilient Global Network Infrastructure: Lessons from the Move Off Corp Modernization Program
authors: Phani Santhosh Sivaraju, Balamuralikrishnan Anbalagan, Vijay Mane, Arya Doshi
publish: 2025 IEEE Pune Section International Conference (PuneCon)
abstract: The increasing digital demands and geopolitical risks as well as the rapid-evolving security threats are testing the global network infrastructures to a level that is unprecedented. The demand to be resilient, defined by the round-the-clock availability, flexibility and security has taken precedence in the organizations that operate globally. The case study of the Move Off Corp modernization program used here offers the vision for the migration of the legacy systems into the cloud-native, scalable, and secure infrastructure as the way to create robust global networks. Comparing architectural principles, resilience evaluation metrics, and implementation strategies, the research demonstrates best practices of redundancy, fault tolerance, automatic failover, and governance based on compliance. The suggested methodology blends a case study and comparative benchmarking with global standards and renders both organizational and technical value of the problem. The results indicate measurable increases in uptime, latencies and sufficiency reduction, and significant risk management lessons, stakeholder coordination, and cost vs. performance balance. The article concludes by situating such results against the broader backdrop of upcoming global infrastructures stressing AI-facilitated resilience, selfhealing networks, and sustainable architectures. Lastly, the Move Off Corp initiative can serve as a model for the enterprises interested in building networks that are not only technologically feasible but also more strategically better suited to the changing nature of global digital environments.

title: Control System Performance Evaluation Method Based on Improved Hellinger Distance under Sensor Degradation
authors: Xin Yan, Yan Chen, Liqun Wu
publish: 2025 IEEE 4th International Conference on Computing, Communication, Perception and Quantum Technology (CCPQT)
abstract: To improve the accuracy of random performance evaluation of control systems, a control system performance evaluation method based on the modified Hellinger distance is proposed. This method introduces weighting coefficients to reduce the interference of various types of noise in the data on the evaluation value. Kernel density estimation is used to calculate the probability density function of the process data. Finally, a simulation model incorporating non-Gaussian noise disturbances and control system sensor degradation is established using MATLAB/SIMULINK. A random perturbation test experiment is designed to compare the Hellinger distance with the traditional minimum variance metric. The comparative results demonstrate that this method can flexibly and effectively evaluate controller performance.

title: A Composite Approach for Gear Angular Displacement Measurement and Degradation Diagnosis Based on TMR Sensors and Eddy Current Effects
authors: Hangqi Zhang, Yangyang Wang, Longtao Jiang, Deran Dong, Tianheng Zhang
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Measurement Control and Instrumentation (MCAI)
abstract: This paper presents a composite sensing method for simultaneous measurement of gear angular displacement and detection of degradation failures. The approach integrates the eddy current effect with a Tunnel Magneto-Resistance (TMR) sensor. A high-frequency excitation magnetic field is constructed to serve a dual purpose: it energizes the TMR sensor and induces eddy currents between the excitation coil and the gear surface. The resulting variations in magnetic field intensity differ under various degradation conditions, enabling fault identification. The paper details the working principles and sensor output mechanisms. Finite element simulations are also conducted to validate the method's dual functionality. The simulation results confirm the feasibility and effectiveness of the proposed sensing approach.

title: Predictive Modeling of Academic Success Based on Real-Time Learning Behaviors in LMS Platforms
authors: B. Moganapriya, F. Mary Harin Fernandez
publish: 2025 2nd International Conference on Artificial Intelligence and Knowledge Discovery in Concurrent Engineering (ICECONF)
abstract: As online learning usage grows, there is a greater need to understand how student activities affect academic success. Classic methods focus on static parameters such as final grades or presence, which cannot reflect the continual and changing nature of virtual learning. Such techniques may overlook key implicit behavioral cues such as content engagement, consumption, and interaction patterns. To solve these issues, the proposed system uses machine learning models that pay attention to behavior, along with random forests (RF), support vector machines (SVM), and gradient boosting (GB), which analyze real-time data from the learning management systems (LMS), like how long students spend in sessions, how many videos these watch, their participation in forums, and how timely these submit assignments. The proposed system uses preprocessing, feature extraction, and predictive modeling to forecast academic performance. It demonstrates that these segments outperform existing system structures, with 91.6% accuracy, 90.2% precision, 89.7% recall, and an F1-score of 89.9%. It also has the lowest RMSE (5.6) and MAE (4.1), indicating that the proposed system is resilient for performance prediction and intervention.

title: Privacy-Preserving Glaucoma Detection Through Blockchain-Enabled Federated Deep Learning
authors: Trupesh Patel, Rajesh Gupta, Sudeep Tanwar
publish: 2025 IEEE International Conference on Blockchain and Distributed Systems Security (ICBDS)
abstract: Healthcare plays a vital role in human life during an illness. Technological advancements in healthcare enhance diagnostic capabilities, which plays a critical role in saving human lives. This Paper proposed a blockchain based federated learning to detect glaucoma, an irreversible optic disease. We used VGG16 model at client side, an advanced deep learning model for medical imaging and FedAvg at server side as federated learning technique. We used two clients with Rim-One dataset and one server that exchanges their model weights using blockchain technology for privacy preservation. Our proposed model reported 78.98% of an accuracy, 85.90 % of specificity, and 82.67 % of an AUC score, a strong relevance in medical image analysis. In addition to this, we provided DenseNet121 results in centrlaised DL and FL setup for comparative analysis.

title: Hybrid Graph-Transformer Framework for Intelligent Pseudocode to Source Code Synthesis
authors: Hari Krishnan R, Philomina Simon, Gokul Krishna S, Deepak V M
publish: 2025 IEEE Pune Section International Conference (PuneCon)
abstract: In software engineering pseudocode to source code generation plays a vital role in acting as a bridge between the complex algorithmic descriptions to the program for execution. This paper mainly provides a hybrid architecture that mainly combines the Graph Attention Networks (GAT) with the transformer model. The pseudocode contains the sequential textual information as well as the structural algorithm relationships that requires dual modality processing. A three-layer GAT encoder with multi-head attention mechanism captures the important features such as type encoding and positional information are used. These are integrated with the T5 encoder. Then, the T5 decoder utilizes the enhanced representation for conditional code generation. The model is evaluated using the BLEU metrics and thus demonstrates the improvements over the baseline approaches and projects the performance in the proposed hybrid model.

title: Internet of Things in the Era of Smart Applications: Emerging Trends and Future Challenges
authors: Udhaya Shankar S, Nivas Kumar V, Dhivyabharathi R, Tamilselvi B, Anish T P, Nalini M
publish: 2025 5th International Conference on Evolutionary Computing and Mobile Sustainable Networks (ICECMSN)
abstract: IoT has emerged to be one of the most important aspects of contemporary digitalization, allowing billions of devices to be interconnected and gather, process, and share data to make smarter decisions and automate processes. This survey paper discusses the background, uses, current trends and future research directions of IoT in the development of intelligent and sustainable systems. It emphasizes the combination of IoT with other high-tech technologies, including artificial intelligence, blockchain, 5G/6G, digital twins and Metaverse, which increases scale, security, and real-time intelligence. There is also a focus on the role of big data analytics, edge and fog computing, and machine learning in facilitating efficient and responsive IoT solutions. In addition, the paper covers some of the major issues such as interoperability, energy efficiency, privacy, trust, and ethical implications, which are still major obstacles to mass adoption. The recent progress in green IoT, sustainability-based applications and human-oriented methods highlight the transformational nature of IoT in establishing resilient societies. This survey highlights the potential of IoT to transform various industries including healthcare, transport, agriculture, smart cities, and industries by examining the existing developments and the emerging technologies. Finally, the IoT has advantages and disadvantages that need to be developed by further research, cooperation, and policies to support the development of secure, ethical, and sustainable smart applications.

title: Task Offloading and Resource Optimization Based on Dependency-Aware Graph and Collaborative Deep Reinforcement Learning in Mobile Edge Computing
authors: Xiangyi Chen, Yuanguo Bi, Juan Zhang, Xiaoming Yuan, Dusit Niyato, Liang Zhao, Xingwei Wang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Mobile Computing
abstract: In mobile edge computing (MEC), computation offloading serves as an effective solution to bridge the gap between the stringent latency requirements of computational tasks and the limited processing capabilities of terminal devices (TDs). However, complex inter-task dependencies, dynamic network conditions, and the decentralized architecture of MEC systems pose significant challenges to efficient and adaptive task offloading. To address these challenges, this paper investigates dependency-aware task offloading and resource optimization in MEC environments. First, we propose a task feature extraction method based on dependency-aware graph neural networks (FEDG), which captures the hierarchical structure and varying importance of subtask dependencies by adaptively learning the aggregation weights of predecessor nodes and edges. Then, to address the joint dependency-aware task offloading and resource allocation problem under partial observability in MEC networks, we design a Dependency-aware Graph-based Multi-Agent deep reinforcement learning (DGMA) algorithm. DGMA integrates adaptive prioritized experience replay and correlation-based selective parameter sharing to improve learning efficiency and accelerate convergence in multi-agent environments. Extensive simulations demonstrate that DGMA achieves superior performance in terms of delay, energy consumption, offloading utility, and deadline violation rate.

title: Performance Evaluation and Experimental Validation of a Three-Level Neutral-Point-Clamped Inverter with 240CPWM
authors: Deliang Wu, Hafsa Qamar, Haleema Qamar, Xiaosa Sui, Jia'ao Xu
publish: IEEE Open Journal of Power Electronics
abstract: Neutral Point Clamped Three-Level Inverters (NPC 3LI) are widely used in dc to ac power conversion due to their superior waveform quality and reduced voltage stress compared to two-level inverters. The performance of NPC-3LI can be further improved by employing a low-loss 240◦-Clamped Pulse Width Modulation (240CPWM) technique. 240CPWM is currently the lowest switching loss PWM method in cascaded configurations comprising a dc-dc stage followed by a dc-ac stage, reducing the dc-ac stage switching losses by at least 80% compared to the conventional Space Vector PWM (SVPWM) at unity power factor. In this work, the performance enhancement of NPC-3LI using 240CPWM in terms of total harmonic distortion (THD) and switching loss is presented and compared with benchmark PWM methods. The THD analysisis carried out using the concept of virtual stator flux ripple, and power losses (switching and conduction) are derived by analyzing the switching device char acteristics and the phase relationship between the modulation voltage and output current. A three-closed-loop control method is also developed for the front-end boost converter to achieve an effective neutral-point voltage balance. The analytical results are validated using a 3 kW experimental prototype. A peak efficiency of 97.71% is achieved for NPC-3LI with 240CPWM at 3 kW, compared to 97.22% with SVPWM, while maintaining comparable THD performance.

title: Explainable Anomaly Detection in Dynamic Heterogeneous Graphs via Relation Evolution
authors: Xiaolin Han, Xiurui Hu, Chenhao Ma, Xuequn Shang
publish: IEEE Transactions on Knowledge and Data Engineering
abstract: Abnormal behavior detection is crucial in many fields, such as social networks, financial transactions, and cyber security. However, it poses significant challenges due to the intricate structural evolution of heterogeneous graphs and the need for explainable models. To address these issues, we propose a novel method called Explainable anomalous behavior (edge) detection for dynamic heterogeneous Graphs (ExpGraph). ExpGraph captures relation-aware structural evolution to model temporal behavioral patterns and introduces a prototype alignment mechanism to improve both performance and interpretability. Specifically, prototype alignment enhances detection by en couraging discriminative representations of normal behaviors, which facilitates more accurate identification of anomalies. It also improves interpretability by enabling intuitive explanations through measuring how anomalous behaviors differ from learned normal prototypes. We conduct extensive experiments to evaluate ExpGraph against advanced competitors. It demonstrates that ExpGraph is 16.2% more effective than other methods on average. Moreover, it offers a deeper insight into abnormal behaviors in dynamic heterogeneous graphs. Our code is available at https://github.com/anonymous-123a/ExpGraph.
